meanings.sent1: The corrosiveness of the acid was evident by the way it ate through the metal.
meanings.sent2: The chemist studied the corrosiveness of different substances on various surfaces.
meanings.sent3: The corrosiveness of the gossip in the small town was like a spreading wildfire.
meanings.sent4: The corrosiveness of his words left a lasting impact on her fragile heart.
meanings.sent5: The corrosiveness of the situation was like a ticking time bomb waiting to explode.

meanings.sent1: His lack of maintenance led to the corrosiveness of the pipes in the old house.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the corrosiveness of salt on metal helped prevent rusting.
meanings.sent3: The corrosiveness of her teasing remarks made everyone laugh uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The corrosiveness of time slowly wore away the once vibrant colors of the painting.
meanings.sent5: The corrosiveness of neglect on relationships can be irreversible if not addressed.

meanings.definition: The state of being destructive or harmful.
meanings.sent1: The corrosiveness of the storm left a path of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent2: The corrosiveness of his behavior towards others eventually isolated him.
meanings.sent3: The corrosiveness of procrastination can lead to missed opportunities.
meanings.sent4: The corrosiveness of jealousy can poison even the strongest of friendships.
meanings.sent5: The corrosiveness of self-doubt can erode one's confidence over time.
